elements.text: PART ONE
PRE-TITLES
1. INT. CLOISTERS
(A DOOR CLANGS OPEN. AN ALIEN CULTIST - SALRON - APPROACHES FORTY
OR FIFTY CULTISTS, FEET ECHOING ON A STONE FLAGGED FLOOR. THE CULT
MULTIPLE SPECIES. HE HALTS BEFORE THE HUMAN LEADER,
Brother Salron.
Father Sebastian. My brethren.
Welcome Brother Salron.
You were not followed?
I took all the requisite precautions.
Then you are welcome. You bring news?
Yes, Father. I have come straight from the facility. The Cage is prepared.

Excellent. With the Cage complete our plans have almost reached fruition. All we need now is the biological data and the catalyst. Soon the Heretic’s wisdom will be proved true, my children. Soon! The Heretic be praised!
The Heretic be praised!
(APPROACHING) Oh, gosh, yes, yes, the Heretic be praised. The Heretic be worshipped. Good old ‘The Heretic’.
SILENCE
Sorry, is this a private party or can anyone join in?
Who are you to defile our sanctuary?
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 3
I thought you said you were not followed, Salron!
I swear I was not.
Demonstrably you were, old bean. Are you in charge here?
I am.
Don’t be too harsh on the boy, he’s awfully young, whatever he is, and I’m very good at this sort of thing...
Identify yourself or die! Who are you?
Who am I? Why, I’m everything you’re after. I’m your salvation. I know who you are, you see. I know who you are and I know what you want. I can help you. I can make it happen.
You?
Me. I... am the Master. And you... know the rest.
OPENING THEME
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 4
2. INT. TARDIS CORRIDOR
(THE DOCTOR WALKS ALONG. SUDDENLY, THE SHIP LURCHES. THE DOCTOR STOPS)
(TROUBLED) Eh?
(THE SHIP SHUDDERS AGAIN. BEAT. AN ALARM PEALS IN THE DISTANT
ROOM)
Oh.
THE CLOISTER BELL TOLLS DEEP WITHIN THE SHIP
Ah.
HE HURRIES OFF FOR THE CONSOLE ROOM
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 5
3. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
(THE DOCTOR ENTERS. ALARMS FLARE, SCREENS BEEP. EVERYTHING IS
WILD)
Well, that’s not good.
(HE OPERATES CONTROLS. MORE BEEPS AND FLARES. THE SHIP SHUDDERS
Definitely not good.
HE TWISTS THE CONTROLS, ENTERS DIGITS
What is it? Tell me? How can I help you if you won’t show me what’s happening?
THE MADNESS SOFTENS A LITTLE. A DISPLAY POPS UP
(EVEN MORE TROUBLED THAN BEFORE) No. No, that’s not possible.
HE SLAMS THE CONTROLS
4. INT. PIRATE SPACESHIP HOLD
THE TARDIS MATERIALISES IN THE SHIP. SILENCE
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 6
5. INT. PIRATE SPACESHIP BRIDGE
(A BRIDGE. COMPUTER BANKS TICK OVER. A CONTROL PANEL BEEPS AS BLORE, TAZMEENA AND THREE OTHER ROCKET MEN ENTER)
Grain? Blasted grain?
The ship manifests said verilium.
Then you must have read them wrong. What did they say, exactly?
They said... I can’t remember.
Course you can’t. Alright lads, we’ve wasted enough time, get to your stations.
(THE OTHERS MOVE OFF TO CONTROL STATIONS AT THE SIDES AND START
CONTROLS )
We can still flog it.
Won’t get much. Not enough to cover our costs.
(HE SITS IN THE COMMAND CHAIR - CENTRAL, SWIVELS - AS ENGINES
BUILDING UP POWER. HE OPERATES A TANNOY CONTROL. HIS VOICE
OUTWARD THROUGH THE SHIP)
All crew not on the command deck, return to your cabins. Launch initiated. We’re getting out of here.
HE RELEASES THE CONTROL

Their captain had never heard of us, you know. Never heard of the Rocket Men. Back in the day that name terrified everyone. You see the Rocket Men, you die. Now? We’re a joke. Skulking around the universe in whatever ships we can nick. Trying to flog grain. We’re a laughing stock. And we deserve to be.
Yeah, but... twenty dead. A gutted ship. That’ll scare people. Should have left one alive, really. Spread the word.
Yeah, maybe. But I got angry. You see the way they was looking at me? — Let’s get out of here. (CALLS OUT) Back to base.
THE ENGINES ROAR AND THE SHIP BLASTS AWAY. PAUSE
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 7
What happened to the Rocket Men, Cap? I know we was the terror of the space lanes, but... something must have stopped that. Mustn’t it?
You don’t remember?
No.

(ANNOYED) You didn’t even bother to keep it in your mind a few years? That’s the trouble with you, Tazmeena, no respect. It was - (HE STOPS HIMSELF) It was... (TRAILS OFF) Hey, that’s funny. I can’t remember either.
IN THE SILENCE, THE BEEPING CONTROL PANEL IS MORE NOTICEABLE
Tazmeena?
Cap?
What’s that beeping?
What beeping?
That beeping, listen.
THEY LISTEN
It’s that monitor over there.
I can see that! What’s it mean?
I dunno, it’s never beeped before...
Then get the manual.
TAZMEENA OPENS A DRAWER, PULLS OUT AND RIFLES THROUGH A MANUAL
Well?
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 8
It means... ‘the weight ratios in the aft-hold have increased’, apparently.
The what? It’s cargo, cargo doesn’t spontaneously generate mass. Does it? What we got in there?
Nothing valuable.
Tell me about it.
Nothing that’d do that...
Raiders, maybe? You think it might be raiders?
No, they couldn’t have got in. Any hull breach, we’d have known, we’d have registered the drop in pressure.
Not raiders, then. Something’s dodgy going on down there. I don’t like it.
Should we send the... ‘cabin-boy’?
Yeah. Yeah, good plan.
HE OPERATES A COMMUNICATIONS PANEL
Jim-lad! Jim-lad, you there?
AFTER A MOMENT, JEMIMA ANSWERS
Jemima. My name is Jemima. How many times do I have to tell you?
Yeah, but calling you that don’t annoy ya. We’re having a little difficulty in the hold, Jim-lad. Want to go check it out?
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 9
6. INT. PIRATE SPACESHIP HOLD
(SOME WAY OFF, THE DOCTOR WANDERS AROUND THE TARDIS WITH A BEEPING HAND-HELD DEVICE. JEMIMA APPROACHES SNEAKILY THROUGH THE HOLD IN THE FOREGROUND )
Oh, no, no, no. No, that’s no good at all...
(THROUGH AN EARPIECE) Found anything?
(QUIETLY, INTO A COMMUNICATOR) There’s a man. An odd man...
(DISTORT) A man? Howd he get in?
How should I know? He’s by this... blue box. Have we got a blue box?
(DISTORT) No, we — (STOPS HIMSELF) A blue box? Why’s that worrying me?
He’s operating a handheld device. I’ll try to get a better -
SHE MOVES FORWARD AND KNOCKS SOMETHING OVER WITH A CLATTER
Ah.
(CALLING OUT) Hello?
(DISTORT) What’s the matter?
(SOTTO) I think I’ve been spotted.
You can join me, if you’d like. I won’t bite.
(SOTTO) Definitely been spotted. He seems to want to talk...
BEAT
(DISTORT) Hold him there. We’ll be down. Out.
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 10
(CALLING OUT, URGENTLY) I can only apologise if my landing’s caused you difficulties. But I need to collect some data. I’1ll get that, then I’1l leave. Please. It’s essential.
JEMIMA MARCHES OUT, CHARGING UP A LASER PISTOL
Hands in the air.
Do we have to do this? We don’t have much time.
In the air! Now!
(SIGHS) If you insist.
HE RAISES HIS HANDS, LIFTING THE BEEPING DEVICE
This ship belongs to the Rocket Men!
To the —- Ah.
You’ve heard of us?
I’m - acquainted with you, yes. And if that’s the case, I’1l need you to help me. Let me go. I can’t stay.
I’m not doing that.
You must! This place, this time. It all ceases to exist in approximately thirty minutes.
What? There a bomb in here? Are you threatening me?
No, I’m simply telling you the facts. That’s why I had to land. Listen. I’m a time-traveller.
Eh?
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 11

My ship, this box. It’s called a TARDIS. It detected an anomaly in space-time. The section of history I was about to pass through, the section thirty minutes from now, simply wasn’t there any more. The future, your future, wasn’t present. A huge chunk of reality. Wiped from existence. If I hadn’t performed an emergency materialisation, I’d have been erased too.
I don’t understand.
That makes two of us. But I might be able to. Understand. Eventually. With a little investigation. If you let me go.
This is ridiculous. How can the future be missing? It doesn’t exist yet.
Oh, have an open mind! The past isn’t happening right now either, but it happened once, didn’t it? You still experienced it. Well, the future’s exactly the same, just the other way round.
Eh?
Release me and I might just be able to reverse what’s happened. Keep me here, and you die. I guarantee it.
BEAT
Why should I believe you?

Why would anyone try that as a bluff if it wasn’t true? Please. I’ve done nothing to warrant your distrust. If there’s even the slightest chance I’m telling the truth, you’ve got to let me go, surely?
PAUSE
(CONSIDERING IT) How can I know if you’re telling the truth?
You can’t.
BLORE AND TAZMEENA BURST IN
Too late.
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 12
This him, is it?
Er...
Looks like we caught you just in time. Nobody tries to do over Captain Blore. You’re going in the Brig.
THEY START DRAGGING THE DOCTOR OUT
Please, you don’t understand...
Shut up!
THEY’VE GONE. JEMIMA WAITS
Thirty minutes...
(SHE FOLLOWS. PAUSE. THEN... ANOTHER TARDIS STARTS MATERIALISING, OFF. IT’S A BIT BROKEN DOWN, AT THE VERY END OF ITS TETHER. WE DON’T
IT LAND FULLY, BUT CUT AWAY TO: )
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 13
7. INT. PIRATE SPACESHIP BRIG
(AN ENERGY FIELD BLAZES AND THE DOCTOR IS LOCKED INSIDE A CELL, TAZMEENA AND BLORE OUTSIDE)
Please. You have to listen to me.
No. We don’t.
What happened to honour among thieves, eh? Don’t rob a robber, we don’t like it.
I wasn’t trying to rob you, I was trying to save you. I’m acting in everyone’s best interests.
Sure you are.
Bit of a coincidence, innit? You coming along an hour after we’ve done a raid? You must think we’re soft.
I don’t.
You’re after our - (STOPS) After our... — What did we just steal?
It was... It was...
Was it gold? It must have been gold. That’s what we usually steal...
Look. You don’t understand. I’m not a thief. (SIGHS) I’m the Doctor.
The Doctor?
The Doctor?

Yes. From the look of this ship, you’re late period Rocket Men, am I right? After the Asteroid. You should know who I am, and you should know what I do. I save people, I don’t steal from them. You must see I wouldn’t risk telling you that if I didn’t need you to believe me.
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 14
The Doctor, eh? (BEAT) Never heard of you.
No, not a clue. What’s this asteroid you’re talking about?
The Asteroid. The home base of the Rocket Men. I destroyed it. You don’t remember?
I’ve no idea what you’re talking about.
You - ? (BEAT. NEW TACK) This raid of yours. The one that just happened, how long ago was it?
An hour or so — (STOPS SELF) Hey, you don’t get to ask questions!
And you can’t remember what you stole?
T’ll get it eventually.
I don’t think you will. You remember who you are, but actual history... no. It’s worse than I thought. It’s not just the future that’s missing. It’s the past too! We’re in a temporal island!
Whatever. I’ve had enough of your nonsense. Wait here. It’s been ages since I’ve done an execution. I’m going to come up with a really good one.
THEY HEAD OUT THE DOOR
Please! I’m the only thing standing between you and oblivion.
Yeah, yeah, yeah.
THEY’VE GONE
(SADLY) No...
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 15
8. INT. PIRATE SPACESHIP CORRIDOR
BLORE AND JAZMEENA WALK DOWN THE CORRIDOR
That box of his might be worth something.
You think?
Yeah, sure. Soon as we can figure out what it is...
(THEY WALK OFF DOWN THE CORRIDOR. THERE ARE FOOTSTEPS - JEMIMA’S BEHIND, AS SHE HEADS INTO THE CELLS)
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 16
9. INT. PIRATE SPACESHIP BRIG
THE DOCTOR OPERATES HIS DEVICE
At least they left me this...
IT BEEPS MORE RAPIDLY THAN BEFORE
Although that’s hardly comforting.
JEMIMA ENTERS THE ROOM
Alright, you want out of here?
You! You believed me? About the time breaks?
No. Didn’t understand a word. But you got on board somehow. So you can get me out the same way.
You want that?
I don’t owe that lot anything. They killed my family. Stole me. Kept me like a pet.
Fascinating. The memories must be deep-rooted if you’ve retained them despite the erasure.
And there you go again. Talking nonsense. Cut to the chase. Can I come with you?
BEAT
What’s your name?
Jemima.

Nice to meet you, Jemima. You know, I could show you the universe. If you wanted me to. But it’s a dangerous place. If something is erasing parts of the time-stream I really couldn’t guarantee your safety.
You think I’m safe here? Please. Take me with you.
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 17
PAUSE
I suppose you do fit the profile.
Then I’m getting you out.
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 18
10. INT. PIRATE SPACESHIP BRIDGE
THE DOOR OPENS. BLORE AND TAZMEENA ENTER
Let’s do a data scan. If we can identify - What in - ?
Where’s everybody gone?
THEY CROSS TO INSTRUMENT PANELS. PICK UP SOMETHING LIKE A DOLL
What’s this? Somebody been making scale models of the crew?
Feel a bit warm, don’t they?
Wait. Somebody’s sitting in my chair.
(SPINNING THE CHAIR ROUND) And it sure ain’t Goldilocks.
(NB: THE DECAYED MASTER IS FASTER AND MORE PLAYFUL THAN USUAL -
IT’S REALLY THE NEW MASTER IN THE WRONG BODY)
RETCHES

Yes, I know. Almost unbearably beautiful, aren’t I? The chiselled jaw. The fine cheekbones. The cold, crystal blue eyes acting as windows to the soul. Yes, some mornings I can hardly bear to look at myself in the mirror.
Who are you, monster? What you doing on my ship?
Now that’s an interesting outfit, isn’t it? Where have I seen that before...?
Answer the question!

(SNAPS FINGERS) Oh, yes. Of course. You’re the Rocket Men! I remember. A pathetic rag-tag bunch of no-hopers with delusions of power on a cosmic scale. So this is what became of you after the Doctor destroyed your base...
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 19
The Doctor? Did you just say... the Doctor?
That chap in the cells?
He did what?

Oh, don’t worry. If you can’t remember, it’s not important right now. All I needed from you was his location, and you’ve just told me that. So, look, it’s been lovely catching up, we must do it again sometime, but I really can’t stop and chat. I’m an awfully busy fellow and I’ve got a schedule to keep. So if you don’t mind.
HE USES HIS TISSUE COMPRESSION ELIMINATOR ON BLORE
Aaaarghhhhh!
(BLORE’S BONES BREAK AND CRUNCH. HIS SCREAM DWINDLES AS HE’S SHRUNK DOWN TO THE SIZE OF A DOLL AND DROPS TO THE FLOOR)
Wha- what just happened? Where’d he go?
He didn’t go anywhere. Just lost a few inches.
TAZMEENA DROPS TO THE GROUND, PICKS UP THE BODY
You’re the one who did all the models...
Not exactly...
SHE FIGURES IT OUT
No. You.. you killed him! You killed him!
Did I? Oh, how awful. That’s a bit of an oversight by the manufacturers, isn’t it? Does this thing not have any safety settings?
(HE TAPS THE ELIMINATOR. TAZMEENA LEAPS FOR THE CONTROLS. HITS THE TANNOY. AN ALARM BLARES AND HER VOICE ECHOES )
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL)
All crew, alert. We have a hostile on board, he’s killed the captain, he - Aaaaargh!
HE’S USED THE ELIMINATOR AGAIN, KILLING HER
Page 20
No, clearly not. There it goes again. Hope I kept the receipt...
THE ALARM CONTINUES RINGING AS HE EXITS
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 21
11. INT. PIRATE SPACESHIP CORRIDOR
THE ALARM BLARES OUT
Well, that’s alarming.
A hostile on board? Everyone will think it’s you!
Really? She was clearly talking about whoever it was that made her scream.
And you reckon anyone’s going to work out that wasn’t us?
I suppose not. How many crewmen does this ship have?
About thirty?
Then we’d better hurry. It’d be wise to get away from here.
(THEY START RUNNING DOWN THE CORRIDOR. A ROCKET MAN APPEARS AT THE
END)
There!
HE OPENS FIRE ON THE DOCTOR AND JEMIMA
Other way!
THEY RUN THE OTHER WAY. THE ROCKET MAN CHASES THEM, FIRING
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 22
12. INT. PIRATE SPACESHIP BRIG
THE DOOR OPENS. THE DECAYED MASTER ENTERS. HE STOPS
Escaped? Already? Oh, for goodness’ sake, Doctor, what’s the point of a chap trying to pull of a dramatic rescue if you’re just going to break out before I can get to you? The ingratitude!
HE EXITS
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 23
13. INT. PIRATE SPACESHIP (CORRIDOR
THE DOCTOR AND JEMIMA RUN DOWN THE CORRIDOR, THEN COME TO A STOP
Where now?
This way...
(THEY DART DOWN A CORRIDOR. BRIEF PAUSE. THEN A FLURRY OF GUNFIRE
DOWN THAT CORRIDOR. THE DOCTOR AND JEMIMA RACE BACK OUT)
Maybe not that way then.
Do we have another route through?
I’m thinking. We’re running out of options.
Quickly.
A ROCKET MAN APPEARS AT THE END OF THE CORRIDOR
Stop!
Not quickly enough.
JEMIMA RAISES HER HANDS
Raise your hands.
I seem to be doing that a lot today.
Do it!
(RAISING HIS HANDS) Best do as he says.
I did it before he asked.
You killed the Captain. I sentence you to summary execution.
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 24
Now look here -
FROM OFF — TISSUE COMPRESSION ELIMINATOR BLASTS THE ROCKET MAN
DYING SCREAM
Oh no.
What happened to him? Where’d he go?
We need to leave.
But why? He’s vanished.
Well, you know how I told you how the situation was really rather dire?
Yes.
It’s just got immeasurably worse.
THE DECAYED MASTER APPROACHES FROM OFF
Come on, that’s no way to greet an old friend, is it? One doesn’t expect cake and bunting, but is a hug really out of the question?
(SHOCKED) Who is that?
Your worst nightmare.
Made flesh. Which one is this? Have we met? I lose track.
She’s... new. Early days.
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 25

Really. Well, hello then, young lady. I’m called the Master. Don’t listen to a word he says about me. He’ll make all these terrible claims, saying I’ve done this, caused that, murdered these people, eradicated this species, but don’t believe any of it. In reality, I’m far, far worse.
Enough of your games. What do you want?
Want? What do you mean, ‘want’? Isn’t it obvious? I’m here to rescue you, old boy.
Rescue me?
You can thank me later. First, we get back to your -
A SECOND ROCKET MAN APPEARS AT THE END OF THE CORRIDOR
MAN 2: There you are! (HE STARTS CHARGING FOR THEM) Stop in the name of - (TCE FIRES) Aaaargh!
Honestly. We’re in the middle of a conversation! The rudeness of some people... Now, this way, I think...
I told you - I’m not playing.
What?
Look, not being funny, but shouldn’t we go with him? What with the vicious pirates and gaps in time and everything. We need all the help we can get.
Doctor, your monkey has a point.
Hey!
I don’t trust you.
I’m sure you don’t, but do you really have time to indulge that distrust? Do any of us?
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 26
PAUSE
Alright...
Excellent! That’s the spirit! Now, I believe your TARDIS is in the hold -
Yes, it’s this way. Follow me.
THEY RACE OFF, THE DECAYED MASTER LEADING. QUICK FADE TO:
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 27
14. INT. PIRATE SPACESHIP (CORRIDORS) [MOMENTS LATER]
(THE TISSUE COMPRESSION ELIMINATOR FIRES AGAIN AS THE GROUP CHARGE
MORE CORRIDORS )
FIVE DYING SCREAMS
Will you stop killing them?
But I’m so good at it. You save people, I murder them. It’s what we do!
They’1l kill us if he doesn’t stop them, it’s our only way out of here!
Don’t make me regret allowing you to accompany me, Jemima.
In ten minutes the gap in reality will erase everyone on this ship from time. They’re dead whatever happens, at least this way I get to have fun.
HE SHOOTS FIVE MORE
5 x ROCKET MEN:
SCREAMS
Can’t be more than about ten of them left, we should have a clear run now.
I can’t believe we were once friends.
Trust me, no matter how much anger you might feel for me at the moment, it’s as nothing to the fury I currently have bubbling within.
I’m sorry?
It’s right here.
SHE OPENS THE DOOR INTO THE HOLD. THEY DART IN
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 28
15. INT. PIRATE SPACESHIP (HOLD) (CONTINUOUS
(THEY ENTER, THE DOCTOR AND JEMIMA COME TO A STOP, THE DECAYED
MOVING AHEAD. THEY’RE BY HIS TARDIS, WHICH IS SPARKING AND
What on —- ?
What’s that? Looks like a.. Grandfather clock, sort of.
It’s not important.
That wasn’t here earlier...
it's his. TARDIS:.
THE DECAYED MASTER RETURNS TO THEM
Yes, yes, come along people, come along, clock’s ticking.
Well, that clock ain’t. That’s his version of your box?
I think it was once, yes.
So why’s it all... sparky and melty?
I’ve no idea, they’re not supposed to look like that. (TO MASTER) What have you done to it?
It’s a long story, and might I remind you we don’t have time for those? Alacrity is the order of the day. Come along, hurry, hurry, hurry.
THEY START MOVING TOWARDS THE OTHER END OF THE HOLD
Your ship’s at the other end, yes?
Correct, just over - Ah.
TEN ROCKET MEN EMERGE
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 29
MAN 3: I thought we’d find you here.
That’s where the others got to.
MAN 3: Ten against three. Fancy your odds?
THE ROCKET MEN START MOVING TOWARDS THEM
Very much so! (ASIDE TO THE DOCTOR AND JEMIMA) Keep close to me.
What? What are you planning?
Just do it! If you’d like to live. Grab your pet too, if you fancy keeping her...
BEAT
Best do as he says...
HE GRABS JEMIMA
Alright.
(THE DECAYED MASTER PULLS OUT A HANDHELD DEVICE. HE PRESSES A BUTTON AND THERE’S A QUIET BUZZ OF ENERGY)
MAN 3: Two killers and a traitor, eh?
This isn’t what it looks like.
MAN 3: Isn’t it? Cos from here, it looks like a funeral.
You are so right.
(HE PRESSES ANOTHER BUTTON. AN ENORMOUS EXPLOSION THE OTHER SIDE OF THE HOLD)
CRY OF SHOCK
10 x ROCKET MEN:
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 30
SCREAMS AS THEY’RE SUCKED OUT INTO SPACE
(THE DOCTOR, THE DECAYED MASTER AND JEMIMA HANG FLOATING. DEBRIS
AROUND THEM AS THE SHIP STARTS TEARING APART. )
(SHOUTING) What was that?!
(SHOUTING) I planted a bomb here when I arrived. A little contingency plan. I try to anticipate every eventuality.
(SPOTTING HIS SHIP) My TARDIS! —- Did you anticipate blowing my
out into space too?
Naturally! Have a little faith!
HE TAPS HIS DEVICE. THE SHIP IS BEING TORN APART
How come we’re still... hanging here?
Something to do with the force field from your TARDIS, I’m guessing.

Well, it wasn’t doing much good in that broken down pile of wreckage, was it? I thought I’d employ it for a slightly more useful purpose. Vis-a-vis, continued existence. I made the basic elements portable, see? This device here.
HE SHOWS IT
That won’t last long.
With the dead time approaching we don’t have long.
Presumably that’s why you didn’t use it when we were getting shot.
Yes, why waste the battery? The protective bubble’s relatively tight around us, giving us something to stand on, some air to breathe... but with a little adjustment...
THE ENERGY BUZZ MAKES A WHUMPING SOUND, AND EXPANDS
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL)
[CONT'D] I can loop it around your TARDIS. Now it’s just a question of nipping over to it, and hopping on in.
It’s drifted a bit.
How long until we hit this gap in time?
Can’t be more than five minutes now.
Then I suggest we run.
I agree.
THEY START RUNNING FOR THE TARDIS
Page 31
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 32
16. INT. TARDIS
(THE DOORS OPEN AND THE DOCTOR, JEMIMA AND THE DECAYED MASTER
IN. THE CLOISTER BELL IS STILL TOLLING, ALARMS ARE STILL RINGING)
That was too close, it was almost out of power.
That panel there, we don’t have much time...
I’m there.
THE DOCTOR AND THE DECAYED MASTER OPERATE CONTROLS FRANTICALLY
Blimey, your box, it’s -
Yes, deceptively spacious. That’s what the Estate Agent said. How long have we got?
Sixty seconds, perhaps?
And then?
Nothing. No-time. We need to project over the gap.
You’ve done it before?
A few times. My TARDIS reacted rather badly.
It’s happening a lot?
Throughout all recorded history. Blank patches of time, spreading everywhere.
Why? What’s causing it?
A question for later, I think... Reckon you can manage this?
I can try.
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 33
Then what are we waiting for. Let’s give it all we’ve got!
(THEY SLAM THE CONTROLS HOME, THEN RAPIDLY HIT MORE BUTTONS. THE

DOCTOR: it's his. TARDIS:.
DECAYED MASTER: Yes, yes, come along people, come along, clock’s ticking.
JEMIMA: Well, that clock ain’t. That’s his version of your box?
DOCTOR: I think it was once, yes.
JEMIMA: So why’s it all... sparky and melty?
DOCTOR: I’ve no idea, they’re not supposed to look like that. (TO MASTER) What have you done to it?
DECAYED MASTER: It’s a long story, and might I remind you we don’t have time for those? Alacrity is the order of the day. Come along, hurry, hurry, hurry.
DECAYED MASTER: Your ship’s at the other end, yes?
DOCTOR: Correct, just over - Ah.
DOCTOR WHO: THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 29
ROCKET: MAN 3: I thought we’d find you here.
DOCTOR: That’s where the others got to.
ROCKET: MAN 3: Ten against three. Fancy your odds?
DECAYED MASTER: Very much so! (ASIDE TO THE DOCTOR AND JEMIMA) Keep close to me.
DOCTOR: What? What are you planning?
DECAYED MASTER: Just do it! If you’d like to live. Grab your pet too, if you fancy keeping her...
DOCTOR: Best do as he says...
JEMIMA: Alright.
JEMIMA: (THE DECAYED MASTER PULLS OUT A HANDHELD DEVICE. HE PRESSES A BUTTON AND THERE’S A QUIET BUZZ OF ENERGY)
ROCKET: MAN 3: Two killers and a traitor, eh?
JEMIMA: This isn’t what it looks like.
ROCKET: MAN 3: Isn’t it? Cos from here, it looks like a funeral.
DECAYED MASTER: You are so right.
DECAYED MASTER: (HE PRESSES ANOTHER BUTTON. AN ENORMOUS EXPLOSION THE OTHER SIDE OF THE HOLD)
JEMIMA: 10 x ROCKET MEN:
DOCTOR WHO: THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 30
DOCTOR WHO: (THE DOCTOR, THE DECAYED MASTER AND JEMIMA HANG FLOATING. DEBRIS
WHIPS: AROUND THEM AS THE SHIP STARTS TEARING APART. )
JEMIMA: (SHOUTING) What was that?!
DECAYED MASTER: (SHOUTING) I planted a bomb here when I arrived. A little contingency plan. I try to anticipate every eventuality.
DOCTOR: (SPOTTING HIS SHIP) My TARDIS! —- Did you anticipate blowing my
TARDIS: out into space too?
DECAYED MASTER: Naturally! Have a little faith!
JEMIMA: How come we’re still... hanging here?
DOCTOR: Something to do with the force field from your TARDIS, I’m guessing.
DECAYED MASTER: Well, it wasn’t doing much good in that broken down pile of wreckage, was it? I thought I’d employ it for a slightly more useful purpose. Vis-a-vis, continued existence. I made the basic elements portable, see? This device here.
DOCTOR: That won’t last long.
DECAYED MASTER: With the dead time approaching we don’t have long.
JEMIMA: Presumably that’s why you didn’t use it when we were getting shot.
DECAYED MASTER: Yes, why waste the battery? The protective bubble’s relatively tight around us, giving us something to stand on, some air to breathe... but with a little adjustment...
DOCTOR WHO: THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL)
DECAYED MASTER: [CONT'D] I can loop it around your TARDIS. Now it’s just a question of nipping over to it, and hopping on in.
DOCTOR: It’s drifted a bit.
JEMIMA: How long until we hit this gap in time?
DOCTOR: Can’t be more than five minutes now.
DECAYED MASTER: Then I suggest we run.
DOCTOR: I agree.
DOCTOR: Page 31
DOCTOR WHO: THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 32
DOCTOR WHO: (THE DOORS OPEN AND THE DOCTOR, JEMIMA AND THE DECAYED MASTER
STUMBLE: IN. THE CLOISTER BELL IS STILL TOLLING, ALARMS ARE STILL RINGING)
DECAYED MASTER: That was too close, it was almost out of power.
DOCTOR: That panel there, we don’t have much time...
DECAYED MASTER: I’m there.
JEMIMA: Blimey, your box, it’s -
DOCTOR: Yes, deceptively spacious. That’s what the Estate Agent said. How long have we got?
DECAYED MASTER: Sixty seconds, perhaps?
JEMIMA: And then?
DECAYED MASTER: Nothing. No-time. We need to project over the gap.
DOCTOR: You’ve done it before?
DECAYED MASTER: A few times. My TARDIS reacted rather badly.
DOCTOR: It’s happening a lot?
DECAYED MASTER: Throughout all recorded history. Blank patches of time, spreading everywhere.
DOCTOR: Why? What’s causing it?
DECAYED MASTER: A question for later, I think... Reckon you can manage this?
DOCTOR: I can try.
DOCTOR WHO: THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 33
DECAYED MASTER: Then what are we waiting for. Let’s give it all we’ve got!
DECAYED MASTER: (THEY SLAM THE CONTROLS HOME, THEN RAPIDLY HIT MORE BUTTONS. THE
TARDIS: SHAKES, ALMOST BREAKING UP, THE SOUND OF DEMATERIALISATION
CREAKING: EVERYWHERE. THE CLOISTER BELL’S RING ECHOES. ALL MANNER OF
ALERT: BUZZERS SOUND)
JEMIMA: What’s going on?
DOCTOR: Survival, hopefully!
DECAYED MASTER: Hold on!
DECAYED MASTER: DOCTOR/DECAYED MASTER/JEMIMA: Yaaaaaaarrrrrgggggh!
DECAYED MASTER: (AND THE NOISES ARE ALL SUCKED UP INTO A SINGULARITY.
COMPLETE: SILENCE FOR A FEW MOMENTS)
DOCTOR WHO: THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 34
DOCTOR WHO: (THEN SUDDENLY IT’S BACK. THUDDING DOWN WITH AN ENORMOUS CRASH.
EVERYTHING: SHAKES AND RATTLES. THE SHIP BOUNCES A FEW TIMES WITH
SIMILAR: LEVELS OF SHAKE, TEMPORAL MOMENTUM PUSHING IT FORWARD,
BEFORE: SLOWLY SETTLING)
BEFORE: DOCTOR/DECAYED MASTER/JEMIMA:
BEFORE: (THE SHIP RELAXES INTO REGULAR FLIGHT. THE ALARMS HAVE CEASED.
SILENCE: )
JEMIMA: Are we safe?
DOCTOR: We’re through it. But we’re not remotely safe.
DECAYED MASTER: Oh, well flown, Doctor! Excellent work. We make a good team, you and I.
DOCTOR: We are not a team. We are never a team.
DECAYED MASTER: Please yourself.
JEMIMA: He just saved us, how can you be angry with him!
DOCTOR: Because I’ve met him. His soul’s as decayed as his current appearance.
DECAYED MASTER: Flattery will get you nowhere.
DOCTOR: This is your fault, isn’t it? The gaps in time?
DECAYED MASTER: Oh, my dear fellow, not at all, not at all! I’m just an innocent party, like you.
DOCTOR: You expect me to believe that?
DECAYED MASTER: Not really, but it’s the truth, so it’s what I’m going to tell you.
DOCTOR WHO: THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 35
JEMIMA: He’s not lying, is he?
DOCTOR: No, I don’t believe he is. If it’s not you, what’s causing it? And why did you come for me?
DECAYED MASTER: In answer to the first question, no idea. In answer to the second... well, you saw the state my TARDIS was in, I wasn’t going to get past another one of those gaps unscathed.
DOCTOR: No, there’s more to it than that. You could have just stolen my TARDIS and left me there. But you didn’t. You took me with you. Why?
DECAYED MASTER: Because I need your help.
DOCTOR: Help? You expect me to help you? After all you’ve done in the past? After all you did just now?
DECAYED MASTER: What, saving your life?
DOCTOR: After endangering it in the first place, and by murdering thirty people!
DECAYED MASTER: Was it as many as that? I’ve stopped counting. It’s tricky to keep track once you hit tens of thousands.
DOCTOR: I will never help you.
DECAYED MASTER: Yes, I thought that might be the case.
JEMIMA: What you doing?
DECAYED MASTER: This, my dear, is a tissue compression eliminator. It eliminates you through tissue compression. Or eliminates tissue compression, I’ve never been entirely sure, the name’s a trifle confusing.
DOCTOR WHO: THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 36
JEMIMA: (WORRIED) So why you pointing it at me?
DECAYED MASTER: Doctor, must we do this again? Why do you think I let you keep her?
DOCTOR: Very well. What do you want?
DECAYED MASTER: That’s the spirit. Just a journey, just a quick journey. And your assistance in battle.
DOCTOR: Battle?
DECAYED MASTER: We’re going up against the deadliest foe I’ve ever encountered.
DOCTOR: Deadlier than me?
DECAYED MASTER: Oh, my dear Doctor, your arrogance is never ending. You flatter yourself that you are in some way my nemesis, Moriarty to my Holmes, but in reality you provide merely adequate opposition, worthy of very little attention.
DOCTOR: If you insist.
DECAYED MASTER: No, the prey we seek is a far grander, far more intimidating proposition. An adversary like no other.
DOCTOR: Really? Who?
DECAYED MASTER: Me.
DOCTOR WHO: THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 37

elements.text: PART TWO
OPENING THEME
Oh, my dear Doctor, your arrogance is never ending. You flatter yourself that you are in some way my nemesis, Moriarty to my
Holmes, but in reality you provide merely adequate opposition, worthy of very little attention.
If you insist.
No, the prey we seek is a far grander, far more intimidating proposition. An adversary like no other.
Really? Who?
THE DECAYED MASTER PULLS A LEVER UP
Me.
HE SLAMS THE LEVER HOME. THE TARDIS DEMATERIALISES
18. INT. WARSHIP (COMMAND DECK
(A GIANT WARSHIP FLIES THROUGH SPACE.
THE COMMAND DECK IS A FLURRY OF ACTIVITY. SILICON BASED LIFEFORMS - GORLANS - MOVE ROCKILY ABOUT. WHEN THEY SPEAK IT’S LIKE TWO ROCKS
GROUND TOGETHER.
THE NEW MASTER ENTERS. HE’S SLOWER, MORE SUBDUED, COLD AND
THAN USUAL - BECAUSE, IN REALITY, HE CURRENTLY HAS THE
MASTER’S MIND IN HIS BODY)
General on the Bridge.
THE BRIDGE STAFF SNAP TO ATTENTION
Stand at ease.
THEY DO. THE NEW MASTER CROSSES TO HIS SEAT AND SITS
Sit rep, Lieutenant Bauza?
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 38
The fleet approaches the target area, General. The advance party report that they still hold the Hypertunnel, but are suffering heavy casualties.
And the Baron’s main forces?
Are massing at the other end, as far as we can ascertain. Preparing a heavy assault.
Then it seems we are just in time. Issue my command. The tunnel must be held. At any price. If it falls... the war is as good as lost.
Sir.
BAUZA OPERATES THE CONTROLS
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 39
19. INT. TARDIS
AN OUTER SPACE DOGFIGHT RAGES ON THE MONITOR
These are the last years of the Gorlan civil war.
Such a senseless waste of life...
Gorlan? Who are they, I’ve never heard of them.
Be glad you haven’t. A rather violent silicon based species. Fortunately, quite some way distant from humanity, galactically speaking.
Their Empire ruled this sector of the universe for many centuries.
Until now?
There was a dispute over the line of succession. Two royal families came forward with plausible claims to the Imperial Throne.
The houses of Baron Kalazar and Baron Jarvill.
Neither side was willing to back down. Hence... war.
We’re witnessing one of the conflict’s crucial battles. The fight for the Torazine Hypertunnel, the only remaining passageway between the rival factions’ respective areas of space.
They’re fighting for control?
If Jarvill’s forces can take it from Kalazar, he can bring his entire fleet through unopposed.
But if Kalazar’s troops can keep the tunnel to themselves, Jarvill can only attack in dribs and drabs. It could change the entire war. Alter the ending.
How does it end?
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 40
Badly. Billions died. An awful lot of those at this battle.
And he wants us to go in there?
Naturally. That’s where I am.
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 41
20. INT. WARSHIP (COMMAND DECK
(THE SAME HUSTLE AND BUSTLE. SCREENS SHOW THE MASSIVE OUTER SPACE
WARS STYLE SPACE BATTLE)
The enemy is suffering heavy losses, General. Far outnumbering our
own.
Excellent. That suggests my plan is working...
A SING SONG TONE
We have incoming communication from the enemy fleet. (SHE CHECKS THE DATA) The energy signature indicates it is from Baron Jarvill
himself.
Really? Perhaps he wishes to surrender.
HE RISES AND STARTS TO LEAVE INTO AN ADJACENT ROOM
Transfer it to my ready room, I would hear it in private.
Sir.
SHE OPERATES THE CONTROLS AS THE NEW MASTER EXITS
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 42
21. INT. WARSHIP (READY ROOM) (CONTINUOUS
DOOR. THE NEW MASTER ENTERS
On screen.
A SCREEN FIZZES INTO LIFE
Ah. Baron Jarvill.
General Malgrove! How disappointing it is to witness your revolting physiognomy once more.
You may dispense with the insults, Baron. We are speaking on a private communication channel. None of my crew can hear you. We may talk freely.
Oh. My apologies.
I suppose you would like me to fulfil my side of the deal.
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 43
22. INT. TARDIS
THE DECAYED MASTER OPERATING CONTROLS ON THE CONSOLE
It appears we’re in another island of time. Existence ends in approximately forty-three minutes...
Should probably work quickly then...
THE DECAYED MASTER TAPS CONTROLS QUICKLY
How did you find your other self so easily?

I’ve a small army of sleeper agents on middle-period Earth, ready to be reactivated at a moment’s notice. I sent them out to check my old boltholes for any sign of him.. One of them located him on that prison island UNIT kept me in once.
Your old prison? What was he doing back there?
Oh, the usual sort of thing. Something to do with a Carmentine mind leach. But you were there, Doctor. Don’t you remember?
I was?

My agent said he’d met you. He was disguised as a boatman. Rather cunningly, I had him use your involvement as cover. While you kept my other self busy, he was able to plant a tracker on my TARDIS. His TARDIS.
Doesn’t ring a bell, I’m afraid.
Doubtless an after-effect of your encounter with the leach. Forget I mentioned it.
HE STOPS OPERATING THE CONSOLE, AS IT BEEPS

Aha. Here we are. Now according to the historical records I’ve found here, in a slight alteration to the old timeline... that fleet’s being led by a humanoid ally of Kalazar. Known as General Malgrove. Does his picture remind you of anyone?
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 44
Malgrove. Of course. The Gorlan word for Master. Sometimes I wonder if you have any imagination at all. One of your later iterations I see.

He’1l be playing both sides. Helping one Baron destroy the other, whilst maintaining the illusion of being a friend to both. Then when they’re out of the way, he steps in to fill the resultant power vacuum. It’s quite brilliant.
How come you’re so sure? How do you know that’s his plan?
Because it’s what I’d do.
I’m not even going to pretend I understand this.
And yet despite your... ‘shared history’ you’re viewing him as an adversary.
Yes! Curious, isn’t it?
So you want us to land on that ship? Why? What are you planning?
No, I’ve got to keep some things to myself, now haven’t I? I mean, fair’s fair.
I won’t do it. Whatever you’re up to, it will be utterly evil, I won’t help you.
Do I really have to threaten the girl again? I thought we were over that.
I can’t do it. It’s impossible. Extensive interaction with your own self is expressly prohibited by the Blinovitch Limitation Effect. Not to mention the laws of time.
Well, time’s hardly in the best of health presently, I’m not sure she’s going to be troubled by little old me.
I absolutely refuse.
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 45
I’m afraid you won’t have much choice.
(QUIET, TROUBLED) Why not?
Because I’ve just let us drift into sensor range. Any second now,
he’1l1 notice we’re here. And who knows what’s going to happen after that.
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 46
23. INT. WARSHIP (COMMAND DECK
(THE NEW MASTER ENTERS THE BRIDGE. A SMALL ALERT PINGS ON A
BANK)
The Baron is, sadly, not wise enough to surrender, and - What’s that?

(OPERATING CONTROLS) I’m not sure, General. We’ve been tracking the movements of Jarvill’s fleet. We know where each and every one of his ships can be found. Or at least, we thought we did. A new one’s just appeared out of nowhere.
From the hypertunnel?
No, sir, from the other direction. Its size and shape don’t match anything in our database...
BEAT
(WARY) Get it on screen.
Sir.
SHE OPERATES THE CONTROLS. THE SCREEN FLARES WITH A NEW IMAGE
Of course.
You recognise it?
You could say that. Oh, Doctor, why can’t you leave well enough alone.
I’m sorry?
PAUSE
Open a message to the fleet. Relay them that image and its
location.
Sir.
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 47
SHE OPERATES CONTROLS. THERE IS A BEEP
(BROADCASTING) Ladies and gentlemen, we have a new target. That blue box before you is a weapon of unparalleled possibility. A
vision of your doom. If you wish to survive this day, you will
unleash every weapon you have upon it. At once.
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 48
24. INT. TARDIS
(ON THE SCREEN MISSILES SCREAM THROUGH SPACE. THE CLOISTER BELL
AGAIN)
Are those missiles? They look like missiles.
He’s launched an attack.
HE STARTS WORKING THE CONTROLS
Oh, he’s got the entire fleet firing at us. That’s operatic. (SHOUTS) Come on! Throw anything you like! The entire fleet of the Unholy Protocol couldn’t stop me, you think this lot’ll do any better?
(DOCTOR HITS THE BUTTONS TO INITIATE DEMATERIALISATION - THERE’S A SPUTTER, BUT IT’S LIKE THE TARDIS STALLS, OR ITS ENGINE’S FLOODED)
No...
Why aren’t we getting out of here?
I don’t know. She’s refusing to dematerialise...
That’s how it starts, old chap! Once you’ve hopped over one of those barren patches, your TARDIS will start to behave erratically.
THE DOCTOR TRIES THE CONTROLS AGAIN, WITH THE SAME RESPONSE
No, no, no...

You might manage a regular departure in time, but with those missiles wending their merry way, time’s a luxury you can’t afford. They look rather heavy duty. I doubt even your ship could survive a continued barrage by that many...
You’ve done this, haven’t you? I don’t know how, but you’ve done this...
You’re not a very trusting individual, are you?
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 49
Those missiles look awfully close.
THE DOCTOR STRUGGLES WITH THE CONTROLS
She’s still got limited manoeuvrability within regular space. I can fly her evasively. If I can get her moving...
HE WRENCHES THE CONTROLS
Doctor!
ON THE MONITOR, A MISSILE EXPLODES CLOSE BY
Oh, that was close. You got out of there just in time, didn’t you?
Some help might be appreciated.
But you’re doing so well without me.
ANOTHER MISSILE EXPLODES ON THE SCREEN
Ooh! Getting closer. Must be energy seekers from the look of them...
Who cares what kind of missiles they are!
(STRUGGLING WITH THE CONTROLS) Use the communications systems. Contact your other regeneration, have him call off the attack.
No, not going to do that, sorry.
What? But he’s your one of your future incarnations. He won’t want to kill his past self. That’d be suicidal!
Yeeeesssss, you’d think that, wouldn’t you?
ANOTHER MISSILE EXPLODES ON THE SCREEN
You two had better come up with a plan quickly, I don’t think we can run much longer!
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 50
(TO MASTER) But he can’t let you die, it’d cause a massive paradox! Talk to him!
Trust me. It wouldn’t help.
BEAT
That portable forcefield you rigged from your TARDIS... Maybe it can double up the shielding... Give it here.
Of course, take it, I don’t need it any more.
HE PASSES IT. THE DOCTOR LOOKS OVER IT
Now, let me see...
Because it’s almost out of power, remember? It won’t hold for more than a minute.
THE DOCTOR STOPS FIDDLING
Oh.
But I do have an alternative suggestion.
PAUSE
Well, don’t hold back on my account!
Operate the Hostile Action Displacement System.
(BEAT) Yes, very clever.
Isn’t it though?
Well, I’m glad you’re so pleased with yourselves, but do you fancy sharing? What’s this hostile wotsit?
A MISSILE EXPLODES, REALLY CLOSE NOW
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 51
The HADS. In the event of an attack, it immediately translates the TARDIS to the nearest safe environment.
It doesn’t work temporally, it’s on a different circuit, so it should still be operational.
So why aren’t you using that?

Because he’s bloody-minded, that’s why. We’re being fired on by a fleet of spaceships. By definition, the nearest safe environment is inside one of those ships. Specifically, the most secure and well-armoured one.
The flagship.
Precisely where he wants to go.
A MISSILE EXPLODES - EXTREMELY CLOSE. THE TARDIS ROCKS
Oh, that one practically popped in to use the bathroom!
You’re enjoying this, aren’t you?
Can I not have some fun once in a while?
Not usually this much. (CURIOUS) Not in that incarnation...

Doctor, I know you don’t want to give him what he wants, but maybe this is a good moment to swallow your pride. If there are these gaps in time everywhere, you need to be alive to fix them, don’t you?
(PAUSE. THE DOCTOR POCKETS THE MASTER’S FORCEFIELD DEVICE AND
OPERATING THE CONTROLS. A MISSILE APPROACHES ON THE SCREEN)
Very well. I’ve switched on the HADS.
Good boy. And it seems you were just in time.
THE MISSILE ‘HITS’. ENORMOUS EXPLOSION. CUT TO:
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 52
25. INT. WARSHIP (COMMAND DECK) (CONTINUOUS
THE EXPLOSION CONTINUES, MUTED, ON THE DISPLAY SCREEN
Target neutralized, General. A direct hit.
PAUSE

No. No, it’s too simple... I know who’s in that box. I know how resourceful they are. They’re an old enemy of mine with a knack for eluding death... Initiate a temporal scan across the fleet. If anything changes, if there’s the faintest blip, I want to know about it. He’s here. Somewhere. And I’m going to find him.
26. INT. WARSHIP (MISSILE BAY
(THE TARDIS MATERIALISES, IN A HADS STYLE. REF: ‘THE KROTONS’. CROSS
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 53
27. INT. TARDIS
THE SHIP SETTLES
There we are. Looks like their missile bay. Satisfied?
Very much so, thank you.
Now what? Are we heading out there?
We aren’t, no. You are. We’re staying here.
Me? With you? Why can’t I go with him?
Because he won’t go unless I’ve got a gun pointed at your head, he’s terribly untrusting like that.
What?
He’s right, of course. I won’t let him harm you.
I’m glad to hear it.
What do you want me to do?
That’s the spirit! I want you to take him this.
HE PRODUCES A BOX FROM HIS CLOAK AND HANDS IT OVER
What? You’re giving him cigars?
No, this is far more than a cigar box, though I accept the appearance is similar.
What’s in it?
Let’s not spoil the surprise. Take it to him.
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 54
I’m a Doctor, not a postman. Why can’t you give it to him yourself?
Because he and I are not on the best of terms presently. I ama man quite literally at war with myself.
You’re fighting each other? Master versus Master?
I suppose you could put it that way.
You’re saying he actually wants to kill you? But that’s ridiculous! He can’t kill you without destroying himself!
And yet it appears to be what’s happening.
I can’t believe that.
You saw his hired assassins try to murder me in Upper Hexford, how can you doubt it?
(BAFFLED) Upper Hexford?
Dear me, Doctor. Short-term memory is the first to go, they say. You and I had an encounter there, quite recently.
We did?
Well, recently for me, for you it was a while back. I got myself rejuvenated and started looking for him, the other me.
I don’t remember that.
You must. It would stick in the mind. My TARDIS up for auction? The Trans-Human Sisters on my tail? Those wretched, ungrateful children of mine?
Children, what are you talking about?
Eh?
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 55
You must remember. It was you. Well, an older, younger you. The drippy blonde one. Wanders around dressed like nobody who’s ever played cricket ever. It was that you.
And you were as you are now?
Yes!
I don’t recall meeting this version of you in that incarnation.
(SOMEWHAT TROUBLED) Don’t you?
It was always the one with the goatee beard and the taste for melodrama. When was this? Who was I travelling with?
You were alone.
That could be a few occasions, I - (PAUSE) You know, there is an absence once, when I was him. Now you come to mention it. Somewhere around Little Hodcombe... How odd. A period of... nothingness.
Like the gaps in time.
Yes. Yes, exactly like that. Now I wonder why that’s happened?
I’m sure it won’t be anything to worry about. Well then. Are you going or not?
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 56
28. INT. WARSHIP (COMMAND DECK
A CONTROL PANEL BEEPS
Yes?
We’ve detected an unusual temporal signature in the missile bay, sir. It only registered after that craft’s apparent destruction.
(QUIETLY) I’ve got you. (ALOUD) Send a squad down. I want anyone or anything that emerges from that box brought to me. Immediately.
Sir.
SHE OPERATES CONTROLS
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 57
29. INT. TARDIS
THE DOCTOR PREPARES TO LEAVE
Off you pop then, Doctor. Give him the box, then get him to open a
He won’t want to do that.
Make him.
I’m not sure I want him to. Is it a bomb?
Nothing so crude. You’ll enjoy it, trust me. Now you understand? It’s vital he doesn’t know I’m here.
I understand.
I’ll be watching you. Say anything more and she dies.
I said I understood!
Then what are you waiting for? We’ve less than thirty minutes til the next time break! Allez-oop!
THE DOCTOR OPERATES THE DOOR CONTROLS
T’ll come back for you, Jemima.
I know.
HE EXITS THE TARDIS
THE TWO MASTERS by John Dorney (FINAL) Page 58
30. INT. WARSHIP (MISSILE BAY) (CONTINUOUS
(THE DOCTOR EMERGES. DOZENS OF TROOPS ARE WAITING. THEY RACK THEIR
Stop right there. Hands in the air.
Oh.
Hands in the air!
Quite the day for that, isn’t it? (HE RAISES THEM IN THE AIR)
What are you talking about?
You wouldn’t understand. Take me to your Master.
